org.fosstrak.reader.rprm.core
Class NotificationChannel

java.lang.Object
  org.fosstrak.reader.rprm.core.NotificationChannel

public final class NotificationChannel
extends java.lang.Object

A NotificationChannel is used to report notifications to a single host. It has a list of Sources associated with it. Only events coming from these Sources shall be reported. It also has a DataSelector that determines what data should be reported to the host. If no DataSelector is explicitly associated, then the Readers current DataSelector shall be used. Notification shall be sent whenever the associated Trigger fires. Alternatively, a host can also query the NotificationChannel for its contents, using the command NotificationChannel.readQueuedData().

Author:
Markus Vitalini

Method Detail

create

public static NotificationChannel create(java.lang.String name,
                                         java.lang.String addr,
                                         ReaderDevice readerDevice)
                                  throws ReaderProtocolException
Create a NotificationChannel object with a given name. If a NotificationChannel object with the same name exists already, an error is returned. This is a static method. The NotificationChannel will implicitly be added to the list of all NotificationChannels kept by the ReaderDevice object.

Parameters:
name - The name of the notification channel
addr - The host address
readerDevice - The reader device this channel belongs to
Returns:
The instance of the new NotificationChannel
Throws:
ReaderProtocolException - The ReaderProtocolException "ERROR_OBJECT_EXISTS" is thrown

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of the given NotificationChannel object.

Returns:
The name of the NotificationChannel

getAddress

public java.lang.String getAddress()
Returns the address to which this NotificationChannel object sends its notifications as specified by either commands NotificationChannel.create or NotificationChannel.setAddress.

Returns:
The address of the host

getEffectiveAddress

public java.lang.String getEffectiveAddress()
Returns the effective address to which this NotificationChannel object sends its notifications.

Returns:
The effective address of the host

setAddress

public int setAddress(java.lang.String addr)
Sets the address to which this NotificationChannel object sends its notifications.

Parameters:
addr - The address of the host
Returns:
If connect mode was specified, then the return value does not apply and the Reader returns zero. Otherwise, if listen mode was specified, then the return returns the port number assigned by the Reader to listen for host NotificationChannel connections.

getDataSelector

public DataSelector getDataSelector()
                             throws ReaderProtocolException
Returns the DataSelector currently associated with this NotificationChannel object. If there is no DataSelector object associated, the error ERROR_DATASELECTOR_NOT_FOUND is raised.

Returns:
The dataSelector associated to this notification channel
Throws:
ReaderProtocolException - "ERROR_DATASELECTOR_NOT_FOUND"

setDataSelector

public void setDataSelector(DataSelector dataSelector)
Sets the DataSelector object to be used with this NotificationChannel.

Parameters:
dataSelector - The dataSelector to use

addSources

public void addSources(Source[] sourceList)
Adds the specified Sources to the list of Sources currently associated with this NotificationChannel. If some of the Sources to be added are already associated with this NotificationChannel, only the not yet associated Sources shall be added and the command completes successfully.

Parameters:
sourceList - The sources to add

removeSources

public void removeSources(Source[] sourceList)
Removes the specified Sources from the list of Sources currently associated with this NotificationChannel.

Parameters:
sourceList - The sources to remove

removeAllSources

public void removeAllSources()
Removes all Sources currently associated with this NotificationChannel.

getSource

public Source getSource(java.lang.String name)
                 throws ReaderProtocolException
Returns the Source with the specified name currently associated with this NotificationChannel object. If no Source object with the given name exists, the error ERROR_SOURCE_NOT_FOUND is raised.

Parameters:
name - The name of the source
Returns:
The instance of the source
Throws:
ReaderProtocolException - "ERROR_SOURCE_NOT_FOUND"

getAllSources

public Source[] getAllSources()
Returns all Sources currently associated with this NotificationChannel object. If no Sources are currently associated with this object, the command completes successfully and an empty list will be returned.

Returns:
A list of sources

addNotificationTriggers

public void addNotificationTriggers(Trigger[] triggerList)
                             throws ReaderProtocolException
Adds the specified Triggers to the list of Notification Triggers currently associated with this NotificationChannel. If some of the Triggers to be added are already associated with this NotificationChannel, only the not yet associated Triggers shall be added and the command completes successfully. Once a Trigger has been added, it is immediately activated.

Parameters:
triggerList - The triggers to add
Throws:
ReaderProtocolException - "ERROR_TOO_MANY_TRIGGERS"

removeNotificationTriggers

public void removeNotificationTriggers(Trigger[] triggerList)
Removes the specified Triggers from the list of Notification Triggers currently associated with this NotificationChannel. Once a Trigger isnt associated to any object anymore, it is deactivated.

Parameters:
triggerList - The triggers to remove

removeAllNotificationTriggers

public void removeAllNotificationTriggers()
Removes all Triggers currently associated with this NotificationChannel.

getNotificationTrigger

public Trigger getNotificationTrigger(java.lang.String name)
                               throws ReaderProtocolException
Returns the Trigger with the specified name currently associated with this NotificationChannel object. If no Trigger object with the given name exists, the error ERROR_TRIGGER_NOT_FOUND is raised.

Parameters:
name - The name of the notification trigger
Returns:
The notification trigger
Throws:
ReaderProtocolException - "ERROR_TRIGGER_NOT_FOUND"

getAllNotificationTriggers

public Trigger[] getAllNotificationTriggers()
Returns all Triggers currently associated with this NotificationChannel object. If no Triggers are currently associated with this object, the command will complete successfully and an empty list will be returned.

Returns:
A list of triggers

readQueuedData

public ReadReport readQueuedData(boolean clearBuffer)
This command returns the data currently queued for delivery in the report buffer. What data is reported depends on the DataSelector associated with the NotificationChannel.

Parameters:
clearBuffer - An optional flag to indicate if the report buffer should be cleared after the ReadReport is returned
Returns:
The resulting ReadReport

readQueuedData

public ReadReport readQueuedData(boolean clearBuffer,
                                 Trigger trigger)
This command returns the data currently queued for delivery in the report buffer. What data is reported depends on the DataSelector associated with the NotificationChannel.

Parameters:
trigger - The trigger that cause this readQueuedData request
clearBuffer - An optional flag to indicate if the report buffer should be cleared after the ReadReport is returned
Returns:
The resulting ReadReport
